Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals and label them.
The student can show and label the places where these plants and animals live (e.g., water, forest, field).
The student can identify and label what plants and animals need to survive (e.g., water, air, sunlight).
The student can demonstrate how plants and animals use the places they live to meet their needs (e.g., fish in water, deer in forests, plants in sunny areas).
The student can show and label how living things are part of a system working together (e.g., draw arrows to show fish need water, plants need sunlight, etc.).
